text: Not software at all, so really ‘random’.. Which music streaming service do you use? I’ve been a Spotify user for years, but I’m switching to TIDAL.

elements.text: Not software at all, so really ‘random’.. Which music streaming service do you use? I’ve been a Spotify user for years, but I’m switching to TIDAL.

text: I'm on Spotify basically only because of their remote control capabilities (i.e. control any device from any other device), which I don't think anyone matches

elements.text: I'm on Spotify basically only because of their remote control capabilities (i.e. control any device from any other device), which I don't think anyone matches

text: currently I use tidal because they provide FLAC files (lossless compression from CD quality audio).  Like any such service, the DRM is pretty irritating though.  My plan is to wait for protondrive (cloud storage service) to mature a little bit more, and then I will simply drop tidal and simply store all of my music as FLAC files on cloud storage

elements.text: currently I use tidal because they provide FLAC files (lossless compression from CD quality audio).  Like any such service, the DRM is pretty irritating though.  My plan is to wait for protondrive (cloud storage service) to mature a little bit more, and then I will simply drop tidal and simply store all of my music as FLAC files on cloud storage

text: I’ve been comparing Spotify premium and TIDAL premium, both about $10. In my opinion TIDAL is a lot better already.

elements.text: I’ve been comparing Spotify premium and TIDAL premium, both about $10. In my opinion TIDAL is a lot better already.

text: I searched the web, and WhatHifi said that TIDAL’s soundstage is more open, so I guess that’s how I’d describe it. Songs tend to have more clarity and dynamics.

elements.text: I searched the web, and WhatHifi said that TIDAL’s soundstage is more open, so I guess that’s how I’d describe it. Songs tend to have more clarity and dynamics.

text: I got a 3 month trial so I will try TIDAL hifi after that.

elements.text: I got a 3 month trial so I will try TIDAL hifi after that.

text: Something that spotify does that really annoys me is that they replace a lot of music with the remastered versions. Often the remastered versions are worth it, but they don't keep the originals on there!

elements.text: Something that spotify does that really annoys me is that they replace a lot of music with the remastered versions. Often the remastered versions are worth it, but they don't keep the originals on there!

text: They do?

elements.text: They do?

text: also the remastered often suffer from the loudness war

elements.text: also the remastered often suffer from the loudness war

text:
my major complaints about spotify/tidal are all DRM based, and as follows:
- Cannot download music, even in DRM-encrypted files to any device (only allowed on android).
- Sometimes will hang or fail to work entirely if there is no internet connection, even for playing downloaded music.
- They can remove music whenever they feel like it.  This is unpredictable and happens with no warning.

So yeah, it's great to have easy access to that much music, but it's also not something you want to get into if you have a reasonable way of storing your own music and getting it to all your devices

elements.text:
my major complaints about spotify/tidal are all DRM based, and as follows:
- Cannot download music, even in DRM-encrypted files to any device (only allowed on android).
- Sometimes will hang or fail to work entirely if there is no internet connection, even for playing downloaded music.
- They can remove music whenever they feel like it.  This is unpredictable and happens with no warning.

So yeah, it's great to have easy access to that much music, but it's also not something you want to get into if you have a reasonable way of storing your own music and getting it to all your devices

text: TIDAL on Mac indeed has no download, which sucks, but I just verified that the iPad version has download and it works.

elements.text: TIDAL on Mac indeed has no download, which sucks, but I just verified that the iPad version has download and it works.

text: I tried Tidal for half a year when they had some offer but went back to Spotify. Mostly due to it being the cheapest for me but also because it has some features like playlist folders in the side bar that other services lack (not sure about Tidal)

elements.text: I tried Tidal for half a year when they had some offer but went back to Spotify. Mostly due to it being the cheapest for me but also because it has some features like playlist folders in the side bar that other services lack (not sure about Tidal)

text: Tidal has no folders.

elements.text: Tidal has no folders.

text: that's another thing, all that UI stuff like playlist directories and stuff like that... you are trapped in the streaming services ecosystem and can't use your own players.  If you can keep your own music you can do whatever you want

elements.text: that's another thing, all that UI stuff like playlist directories and stuff like that... you are trapped in the streaming services ecosystem and can't use your own players.  If you can keep your own music you can do whatever you want

text: I can't get my own music for the same amount of money. I can't even get a single album for the same price.

elements.text: I can't get my own music for the same amount of money. I can't even get a single album for the same price.

text: it depends.  If you mostly listen to the same music, even with a huge library, over time it makes sense.  Plus, if you can compromise on quality there is a lot of free music available on YouTube.  I wouldn't want any of my favorites from youtube, but I already own most of my favorite stuff so it's not really an issue

text: Djay used to be able to play Spotify, but that ended. It can now play TIDAL and SoundCloud.

elements.text: Djay used to be able to play Spotify, but that ended. It can now play TIDAL and SoundCloud.

text: but yes, i agree there is some value to the streaming services.  I guess I can't reasonably expect much better from tidal.  It's ok for now, but I'm looking forward to dumping it

elements.text: but yes, i agree there is some value to the streaming services.  I guess I can't reasonably expect much better from tidal.  It's ok for now, but I'm looking forward to dumping it

text: ^ I really miss that in djay, was very useful for drum practice to be able to slow down Spotify songs.

elements.text: ^ I really miss that in djay, was very useful for drum practice to be able to slow down Spotify songs.

text: I still use Soundcloud/Mixmatic and YouTube for a lot of music because Spotify doesn't really have continuous mixes. Varies a lot between genres for me.

elements.text: I still use Soundcloud/Mixmatic and YouTube for a lot of music because Spotify doesn't really have continuous mixes. Varies a lot between genres for me.

text: I use Youtube Premium and Youtube Music, and I think that works fairly well. The "discovery" is pretty bad but I find a lot more variety than on Spotify

elements.text: I use Youtube Premium and Youtube Music, and I think that works fairly well. The "discovery" is pretty bad but I find a lot more variety than on Spotify
